title: Swash Types in Use
content:
I’m looking for recent examples of swash typefaces in use for a potential article. Design projects can be from print, web, or other media. Script, text, and display typography - all are welcome. Big clients, little ones, or self-promotional - it’s all good to me. Work can be already published or in process. Please email examples and a brief description of your project to: tamye {a} typelife.com. Looking forward to seeing what you’ve been working on.

 [‹ Help! Inconsistent Diacritic placement has me confused](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121184106/http:/typophile.com/node/38206 "Go to previous forum topic") [Commissioning Fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121184106/http:/typophile.com/node/38083 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tamye

comments.content:
\> Please email examples.....

what is the deadline?

Deadline for emailing me about a project in process is by end of day Wednesday. We can talk about what you’ve got going on and if it will be ready for eyes in time for this piece. Anything you can show/describe at this point would be helpful, David.

What about swashy custom lettering?

- Lex
Lex, email me about it, with images and description of project.
Are you looking for [lettering](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121184106/http:/typographica.org/001079.php), or type only?
Nice use of Incognito, Stephen, thanks. This piece is really type-centric.
Not type, but [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080121184106/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/opera78/1501012549/) wonderfully illustrates the overconsumption of swashes.
Ha! That’s awesome. Floriated windbreaking, even.
